Classic Baked Potato Skins

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking for a deliciously satisfying appetizer or snack, look no further than these classic baked potato skins. Crispy on the outside and filled with savory goodness, this recipe takes simple ingredients to the next level, making it perfect for game day gatherings, family parties, or a cozy night in. With just four large russet potatoes, some olive oil, salt, sharp cheddar cheese, crispy bacon, fresh green onions, and a dollop of sour cream, you can whip up a batch of these mouthwatering delights in no time. Not only are they easy to make, but they also offer a fantastic flavor combination that will have everyone coming back for more. So, preheat your oven and get ready to indulge in one of the best comfort foods around!

Ingredients

russet potatoes

Russet potatoes are ideal for baking due to their starchy texture, which yields a fluffy interior. Make sure to choose potatoes that are firm and free of blemishes. If you can't find russets, you can substitute with Idaho potatoes, which have similar characteristics. Always wash them thoroughly to remove any dirt before baking.

olive oil

Olive oil adds flavor and helps achieve a crispy texture. You can substitute it with melted butter or canola oil if you prefer. For added flavor, consider using infused oils, such as garlic or chili oil. Brush the insides of the potato skins generously for optimal crispness.

salt

Salt is crucial for enhancing the overall flavor of the dish. Use kosher salt for rubbing the skins, as it provides a more even distribution. If you're watching your sodium intake, consider using a low-sodium alternative or seasoning with herbs and spices instead.

cheddar cheese

Cheddar cheese is classic, but feel free to experiment with other cheeses like Monterey Jack, Gouda, or even a spicy Pepper Jack for an extra kick. Make sure to use freshly shredded cheese for the best melt and flavor. If you want a creamier texture, consider mixing in some cream cheese with the shredded cheese.

cooked bacon

Crispy bacon adds a smoky flavor and crunch. If you don’t have bacon, you can substitute with cooked sausage, turkey bacon, or even crispy pancetta for a different twist. For a vegetarian option, consider using smoked paprika or tempeh bacon to mimic the flavor.

green onions

Green onions add freshness and a mild onion flavor. You can substitute with chives or shallots if green onions are unavailable. For a sharper flavor, use finely chopped red onion. To enhance their flavor, lightly sauté the green onions before topping the potato skins.

sour cream

Sour cream is a traditional topping that adds creaminess and tang. If you're looking for a healthier alternative, Greek yogurt works well. For a flavor boost, mix in some lime juice or fresh herbs into the sour cream before serving to elevate the taste.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the oven

    Start by preheating your oven to 400°F (200°C). This ensures that your baked potato skins will cook evenly and achieve the perfect crispiness.

  • Step 2: Prepare the potatoes

    Wash the russet potatoes thoroughly under cold water to remove any dirt. Pat them dry with a towel to make sure they are not wet, which could affect the baking process.

  • Step 3: Prick and season the potatoes

    Using a fork, prick each potato several times on all sides. This allows steam to escape during baking. Rub the potatoes with olive oil to help crisp the skin and sprinkle them with salt for flavor.

  • Step 4: Bake the potatoes

    Place the prepared potatoes directly on the oven rack. Bake for 45-60 minutes, or until the potatoes are fork-tender. Cooking time may vary based on the size of the potatoes.

  • Step 5: Cool and slice the potatoes

    Once cooked, carefully remove the potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. Slice each potato in half lengthwise, making sure to use a sharp knife to avoid tearing the skin.

  • Step 6: Scoop out the flesh

    Using a spoon, scoop out most of the potato flesh, leaving about 1/4 inch of potato around the skin. This helps maintain the structure of the skins while also creating a nice texture.

  • Step 7: Brush with olive oil and season

    Brush the insides of the potato skins with a little olive oil, then sprinkle with a pinch of salt. This will enhance the flavor and help them to crisp up nicely.

  • Step 8: Bake the potato skins

    Place the potato halves cut-side down on a baking sheet. Bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the edges are crispy and golden brown.

  • Step 9: Fill with toppings

    Remove the baking sheet from the oven and carefully flip the potato skins over. Fill each skin with a generous amount of shredded cheddar cheese and crumbled bacon.

  • Step 10: Melt the cheese

    Return the filled potato skins to the oven and bake for another 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese is fully melted and bubbly.

  • Step 11: Garnish and serve

    Once out of the oven, top with chopped green onions for freshness. Serve immediately with sour cream on the side for dipping.

Frequently Asked Questions

What type of potatoes should I use for baked potato skins?

Russet potatoes are the best choice for baked potato skins because they have a starchy texture and a thick skin that crisps up nicely.

How do I properly wash and prepare the potatoes?

Wash the russet potatoes thoroughly under running water to remove any dirt. Use a scrub brush if necessary. Pat them dry with a towel before cooking.

What does pricking the potatoes do?

Pricking the potatoes with a fork allows steam to escape while baking, preventing them from bursting in the oven.

How do I know when the potatoes are done baking?

The potatoes are done when they are tender all the way through. You can check this by inserting a fork or knife into the thickest part; it should slide in easily.

How much flesh should I scoop out of the baked potatoes?

Leave about 1/4 inch of the potato flesh for texture. This helps the skins hold their shape while still being flavorful.

What can I do if I want to add more toppings to my potato skins?

Feel free to get creative! You can add toppings like jalapeños, olives, or even different types of cheese. Just remember not to overload them so they stay crispy.

How can I ensure my potato skins are crispy?

Brush the insides of the potato skins with olive oil and bake them cut-side down on a baking sheet for the best crispiness.

What is the best way to store leftover potato skins?

Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator. To reheat, place them in the oven or toaster oven to regain their crispiness.

Can I make the potato skins ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the skins up to the point of adding the toppings and then refrigerate. Bake them just before serving.

What should I serve with baked potato skins?

Sour cream is a classic choice, but you can also serve them with guacamole, salsa, or a yogurt dip for a fun twist!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

To make the dish vegetarian, simply omit the bacon and consider using plant-based cheese alternatives. For a gluten-free option, ensure that all ingredients are certified gluten-free, especially any sauces used for serving. If you want to make it healthier, you can use Greek yogurt in place of sour cream and reduce the amount of cheese.

Pairings

Serve Classic Baked Potato Skins with a side of tangy barbecue sauce or a spicy ranch dressing for dipping. Pair these indulgent bites with a crisp lager or a light-bodied white wine like Sauvignon Blanc, which can cut through the richness of the cheese and bacon. For a non-alcoholic option, a refreshing cucumber lemonade complements the dish beautifully by adding a citrusy brightness.

Serving Suggestions

Arrange the baked potato skins on a rustic wooden platter for a casual gathering. Garnish each skin with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of additional green onions for color and flavor. For an added touch, serve with toothpicks for easy eating and a small bowl of extra bacon or cheese on the side for guests to customize their skins. Ideal for game day, parties, or as a fun appetizer at a barbecue.

#

Classic Baked Potato Skins

40 min
$5
300 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

DairyGluten

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

American

Course:

SnackAppetizer

Tags:

SnackAppetizerEasy

Description

Crispy potato skins loaded with cheese, bacon, and green onions for a delicious snack or appetizer!

Ingredients

  • russet potatoes: 4 large
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: 1 teaspoon
  • cheddar cheese: 1 cup shredded
  • cooked bacon: 1/2 cup crumbled
  • green onions: 1/4 cup chopped
  • sour cream: for serving

Date Created:

11/17/2024
